img.alt: 4 girls with arms around each other sporting white bear lake area schools apparal

li.a: White Bear Lake Area Educational Foundation

img.alt: female student smiling and point at white board to a word that is in french
female teacher smiling sitting on blanket she made with 4 female students around her
bear costume giving thumbs up next to a carrot costumed person

p.span: Providing the latest recommendations and information surrounding the rapidly evolving Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak.

div.p: The district continues to monitor updates from the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and will keep families and staff members informed as the situation evolves.

div.class: fsDiv fsStyleOneThird fsStyleColumn fsStyleColumn-2 fsStyleColumn-last fsStyleAutoclear

li.a: What links have been shared for registration of services?
Will breakfast and lunch be available?
Will activities be canceled this spring?
Can I get into the school to get items in my child’s locker?
Where can I find updated information about COVID-19?
How can I talk to children about COVID-19?
When can families access the buildings?

h2.a: What links have been shared for registration of services?

li.a: White Bear Essential Community Care - Tier 1 & Tier 2 Childcare request form
Free Bear Care Health & Wellness Clinic

div.p: The Minnesota Department of Education defines distance learning as: Students engaging in distance learning have access to appropriate educational materials and receive daily interaction with their licensed teacher(s).

The Governor announced on Wednesday, March 25 that all Minnesota school districts must implement a Distance Learning Period from March 30 to May 4. Find additional information about the district's plan on the Distance Learning Info page.

h2.a: Will breakfast and lunch be available?

div.p: Breakfast and lunch are available free of charge to all children age 18 and under, and persons over 18 years of age who have been determined eligible for transitional education services by the MN Department of Education.

School site meal pick-up will be offered at the following three locations from 9:30am to 10:30am on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. (Two breakfasts & two lunches will be provided on Monday & Wednesday, with one breakfast & one lunch being offered on Friday.)

ul.li: Oneka Elementary (4888 Heritage Pkwy North, Hugo, MN 55038)
Birch Lake Elementary (1616 Birch Lake Ave, White Bear Lake, MN 55110)
Willow Lane Elementary (3375 Willow Ave, White Bear Lake, MN 55110)

div.p: Neighborhood meal pick-up will be offered at the locations below. ISD624 buses & vans will arrive between 8:45 & 9:45 a.m. on Wednesdays each week. All neighborhood pick-up sites will receive five breakfasts and five lunches per child on Wednesdays each week.

ul.li: 15057 Forest Blvd N, Hugo
1175 Country Rd D E, Maplewood
973 County Rd D E, Maplewood
1053 County Rd D E, Maplewood
Village Trail & Flandreau Trail, Maplewood
200 Mayfair Rd, Vadnais Heights
3521 Century Ave N, WBL
3149 McKnight Rd N, WBL
1634 9th St, WBL
1501 Park St, WBL
1805 Cedar Ave, WBL

div.p: If they are able, families should let us know they’ll be picking up meals by filling out this form.
Staff members will be in contact with those families who have requested home delivery.

div.h3: Map of Neighborhood Meal Pick-Up Locations
div.p: Zoom in for a more detailed look.

The district continues to provide childcare for Tier 1 healthcare and emergency responders (defined below). Starting March 30, and as the district has capacity to do so, we will accommodate those groups of employees that the governor has identified as Tier 2 employees (defined below).
Care will be provided for children ages 4-12 years old. This service will be free to families and the hours for these services will be from 6:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Locations will be:

li.p: Oneka Elementary (4888 Heritage Pkwy North, Hugo, MN 55038)
Birch Lake Elementary (1616 Birch Lake Ave, White Bear Lake, MN 55110)
Willow Lane Elementary (3375 Willow Ave, White Bear Lake, MN 55110)

div.p: In order to qualify for, and utilize this childcare service, parents will be required to either provide a letter from their employer or show an employment badge indicating that they are working within at least one of the areas that MDE has described below.

li.p: Health care providers and systems, including hospitals and clinics
Post-acute and long-term care facilities, including nursing and assisted living facilities
Other health systems and organizations, such as:
State and local public health agency employees
Or any county staff in emergency management or health and human services
State and local essential IT personnel
Day-to-Day Operations for Gas & Electric Utilities
Emergency Response for Gas & Electric Utilities

p.br: For students and families who meet the requirements above, and are in need of school-based childcare, we ask that you either register via this link or call 651-407-7501. Please leave a voicemail if calling outside of work hours.

div.p: Registration is required for Tier 2 childcare. Those who register and are accepted will be contacted with confirmation of their child’s site within 24 hours, Monday-Friday. Receipt of this notice is required before students will be accepted at the childcare site.
For students and families who do not meet the requirements above, regular White Bear Lake Area Schools’ childcare programming will be closed.
In following the lead of our municipality partners, all school district playgrounds have been closed to the public. We will inform the community when district playgrounds have reopened.

The district’s outdoor green spaces remain open and provide a great place to keep kids active. With more and more children heading outside, we ask you to remind your children to continue to practice social distancing and should:

ul.li: Avoid team sports, group activities and shared sporting equipment.
Avoid crowded parks and trails.

div.p: Additional best-practice protocols also include:

ul.li: Stay home if you are sick
Wash your hands frequently
Put 6 feet of distance between yourself and others
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands

div.p: Find additional information here.

h2.a: Will activities be canceled this spring?

div.p: The district is working on a process for refunding fees that have been collected for middle school and high school spring activities. Refunds are expected to be processed on or before Friday, April 3. We remain hopeful that we will be able to offer an abbreviated spring season, a decision that would come from Governor Walz and the Minnesota State High School League at a later time. If we do have a shortened season, we will not charge a fee for students to participate.
Community Services and Recreation Department enrichment activities and programs are canceled through May 4 at this time. The department will be in contact with registrants re: refund options.

h2.a: Can I get into the school to get items in my child’s locker?

div.p: All school buildings were open before the governor's Stay at Home order so that families could have access to their children’s lockers. If additional arrangements need to be made, families should contact their principal.

h2.a: Where can I find updated information about COVID-19?

li.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

h2.a: How can I talk to children about COVID-19?

div.p: We understand adults may have questions about how to talk to their children about Coronavirus. The CDC has created guidance to help adults have conversations with children about COVID-19 and ways they can avoid getting and spreading the disease. General principles for talking to children include:

ul.li: Remain calm and reassuring.
Make yourself available to listen and to talk.
Avoid language that might blame others and lead to stigma.
Pay attention to what children see or hear on television, radio, or online.
Provide information that is honest and accurate.
Teach children everyday actions to reduce the spread of germs.

div.p: Complete information about this guidance can be found here.

h2.a: When can families access the buildings?

div.p: Starting Monday, April 20 all White Bear Lake Area Schools will have consistent office days and hours of Tuesdays and Thursdays from 1-4 p.m. Buildings will be locked, so families should continue to reach out to building principals to arrange for at-school pick-up of materials during this window of time.

ul.li: Be The Light MN initiative - Each Monday at 8:20 p.m. (20:20), White Bear Lake Area High School will be part of #BeTheLightMN, turning on the stadium lights at South Campus for 20 minutes and 20 seconds to honor the class of 2020. (We are missing ALL of our students, but are really thinking about our seniors!) Please enjoy the lights from afar and practice social distancing.

White Bear Window Display - In these days of community engagement via socially distanced window dressings, we invite you to join the fun in creating a White Bear Window for friends and neighbors to enjoy while they walk the neighborhood. Create your own "Go Bears!" Bear, or decorate the one provided here, to display in your window. Email pics of your White Bear Window display to communications@isd624.org for the chance to be included in upcoming district share-outs. Go Bears!

img.alt: istance Learning to be implemented March 30 to May 4

Free Bear
Care Health
& Wellness
Clinic

March 25, 2020 - Distance Learning March 30 to May 4, childcare info
March 20, 2020 - Family & Staff Message: Friday Update
March 18, 2020 - Staff Message: On-site Staff Childcare Update

div.p: As we all work to be healthy, it is important to remember to take the same precautions recommended for avoiding colds and flu:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water.
Avoid close contact.
Stay home if you are sick.
Cover coughs and sneezes.

a.span: 4855 Bloom Avenue, White Bear Lake, MN 55110
